channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- Per page add to head
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- Per page add to head

item.title: CVE-2021-24619|2024-08-03T19:35:20.279Z -- unknown -- per%20page%20add%20to%20head
item.description: The Per page add to head WordPress plugin through 1.4.4 does not properly sanitise one of its setting, allowing malicious HTML to be inserted by high privilege users even when the unfiltered_html capability is disallowed, which could lead to Cross-Site Scripting issues.

item.title: CVE-2021-24586|2024-08-03T19:35:20.192Z -- unknown -- per%20page%20add%20to%20head
item.description: The Per page add to head WordPress plugin before 1.4.4 is lacking any CSRF check when saving its settings, which could allow attackers to make a logged in admin change them. Furthermore, as the plugin allows arbitrary HTML to be inserted in one of the setting (feature mentioned by the plugin), this could lead to Stored XSS issue which will be triggered either in the backend, frontend or both depending on the payload used.
